result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donayia M Daniels

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Donayia M Daniels in court.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court for Donayia M Daniels.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

As to Count 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and WITHHOLDS entry of judgment of conviction into the record.

Early Intervention Program Deferred Prosecution Agreement received and filed.  Court orders case adjourned for review hearing.  Case adjourned for review hearing before Judge Stark  , Branch 17, per Chief Judge Directive.
Review hearing scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Donayia M Daniels in court.  
Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court for Donayia M Daniels.  
Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case calendared for a Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing.
Defense in receipt of final draft of the dpa document.
Court ordered matter adjourned to Branch 37 for Branch 19.
Parties advised this hearing will be held in person, Room 515 of the Court house.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing on October 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Per email correspondence with the Parties Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing has been rescheduled to October 12, 2022 at 11:00am.

Defendant Donayia M Daniels in court. 
Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court for Donayia M Daniels.  
Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Status Conference. 
Parties are still in negotiations for a DPA Offer and request an hearing date.
Case remains calendared in Branch 19. Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Donayia M Daniels in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Stephan Eduard Nolten for ADA Michael Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense in receipt of discovery and offer from the State.
Defense has request the State to consider this case for a potential dpa and tad evaluation is scheduled 8-25-2022.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  Status conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:53 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Donayia M Daniels in court with Attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Samuel E. Simpson, appearing for Michael Staskunas, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.
Parties in court for scheduling conference.
A review of the case and the charges indicates this case should be heard before a general felony court.
On June 28, 2022 a request for substitution was filed as to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  During that hearing the case was transferred to Branch 28.
The Clerk of Circuit Court/Substitution Desk was contacted on today's date and was informed that the case should be assigned to Branch 45.

Court orders case adjourned to Branch 45 for scheduling.

Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.

Clerk:  jms

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Wagner.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Sanders, Br. 28.

Defendant Donayia M Daniels in court, appear by video with attorney Sylvan Jaspen, appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.
 Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Oficer R.Parks.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No driving without a valid license.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (6/17/2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Donayia M Daniels in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6/15/2022 @1p
